incidents.name: SMS Delivery Failure to Verizon in the US for a Subset of Long Codes via 10DLC

incident_updates.body: 10DLC SMS traffic via Zipwhip Software/API toward was rejected as not permitted between around 1 PM PST on 5/11 and about 11:30 AM PST on 5/12 to the total of around 19K messages. About 33 wholesale messages from Twilio via ZW that fell into that category were also rejected. During this period of time, customers sending those messages received a negative DLR back corresponding to lack of permission to send on that route. The issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: Connectivity Lost on ~15% of Super SIM Devices

incident_updates.body: We will close the post on Twilioâ€™s Status Page. If you have been impacted by this incident and wish to continue to receive updates, please open a ticket with customer support.

affected_components.name: INTERNET OF THINGS - Super SIM

incident_updates.body:
We have observed that the recent impact was limited to devices connected over AT&T. Currently, we are monitoring the situation as approximately 3% of devices may still experience connectivity issues. These devices might encounter a poor data connection or have short-lived sessions.

Our engineering team is actively working alongside the affected network provider to resolve the issue as quickly as possible. In the meantime, we kindly suggest that customers reset the connectivity through the console if they notice that some of their SIM cards are still experiencing issues. This can often help re-establish a stable connection for the affected devices. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

affected_components.name: INTERNET OF THINGS - Super SIM

affected_components.name: INTERNET OF THINGS - Super SIM

incident_updates.body: Beginning at 8:45 UTC, we observed ~15% of active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped. Devices that attempted to reconnect immediately after losing connectivity should have been able to successfully reconnect to the redundant instances while the impacted one recovered. Our engineering team is actively working with the affected network provider to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 2 hours or sooner once more information becomes available.

incident_updates.body: The Super SIM connectivity interruptions have been resolved and Super SIM is operating normally at this time.

affected_components.name: INTERNET OF THINGS - Super SIM

incident_updates.body: Our engineering team has put in a fix to address the issue causing connectivity interruption. We are seeing recovery and are continuing to monitor for service performance. We will provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

affected_components.name: INTERNET OF THINGS - Super SIM

incident_updates.body: At 3:50 PM PST, the service that previously restarted leading to a drop in connectivity did so again. The previous incident link is https://manage.statuspage.io/pages/gpkpyklzq55q/incidents/phgdhvmjs4x0. A new instance has been deployed and the impacted one has been taken out of the load balancer. Devices currently connected through the new instance and will continue to stay connected as sessions are slowly drained from it.

affected_components.name: INTERNET OF THINGS - Super SIM

incident_updates.body: We have fully investigated the authentication issue triggered by our automated alert, and it was determined that there is no noticeable customer impact. All systems are operational.

incidents.name: Super SIM Connectivity Interruption

incident_updates.body: Our engineering team has identified the the root cause of the service restart to be a side effect of an internal tool used for capturing packet traces to help support customers. We have suspended use of this tool until a fix for this issue is deployed. There should not be anymore connectivity interruptions for Super SIM.

affected_components.name: INTERNET OF THINGS - Super SIM

incident_updates.body:
At 11:13 AM PST, approximately 4% of data sessions connected through the super or us1.super APNs were dropped causing devices to disconnect. This was due to one of the services responsible for routing data traffic between devices and the internet restarting unexpectedly. Devices that lost connectivity should have been able to immediately reconnect to one of the other instances of the same service. The impacted service was recovered within 30 seconds and resumed handling traffic. This issue was not a result of any issues at our downstream connectivity partners.
Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update in 1 hour or as soon as we have additional information.

affected_components.name: INTERNET OF THINGS - Super SIM

incident_updates.body: Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with super sim connectivity issues in the US. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have additional information.

incident_updates.body: Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with the Twilio Console Multi-Factor Authentication system where a subset of users who had configured two factor authentication (2FA) using TOTP were unable to log into the account Console. If you continue seeing this issue please clear your cache and try again. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: 500s for billing-related APIs

incident_updates.body: Billing APIs and Console pages was degraded for 30 minutes between 9:20 and 9:50 Pacific Time on 05/10/2023. During this period, customers may have experienced timeouts and were unable to setup new Flex Accounts, unable to upgrade their Flex Accounts from Flex Trial to Paid and billing information in the console failed to load. The issue has now been resolved.

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with some APIs querying billing data are currently degraded. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: MMS delivery failures to a subset of US carriers

incident_updates.body: MMS delivery was degraded for around 6 hours between 23:30 PT and 6:15 Pacific Time on 5/9/2023 to 5/10/2023. During this period, customers may have experienced failures to send MMS to a subset of US carriers. The issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: Issues with promos and trial balances

incident_updates.body: Billing Pipeline was degraded for 72 minutes between 07:33 and 08:45 Pacific Time on 05/09/2023. During this period, Console users were unable to apply promos and trial balances on  customer accounts. The issue has now been resolved.

We've become aware of a potential issue with Console returning 500 error. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have additional information.

The issue causing errors when Services are created with a previously used name, relating to Voice Intelligence has been identified. We are actively working to resolve the issue. We expect to provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

affected_components.name: INTERNET OF THINGS - Super SIM

incident_updates.body: Beginning at 04:54am UTC, we observed 30% of active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped. Devices that attempted to reconnect immediately after losing connectivity should have been able to successfully reconnect using backup IMSIs. Our engineering team is actively working with the affected network provider to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 1 hours or sooner once more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Voice Intelligence GetTranscripts and GetSentences APIs Returned 404 as Results

incident_updates.body: Twilio Voice Intelligence GetTranscripts and GetSentences APIs were degraded for 16 minutes between 2:08pm and 2:24pm Pacific Time. During this period of time customers may have experienced API request returns of 404 status. The issue has now been resolved.
